Project.Brief history of your project and organi: MUSIC-AVQA, focused on teaching AI to understand both sound and vision. It introduced a large dataset of music performance videos with questions, allowing AI to learn how to answer by looking and listening. The project gained recognition at a top AI conference (CVPR) and was updated in 2023 to improve fairness. We continues to explore how machines can better understand the world through multiple senses.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The MUSIC-AVQA dataset stores video clips of musical performances, audio features, visual features, and question-answer annotations. These files are currently hosted on platforms, Google Drive.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: To store the data, it is first uploaded and given a unique Content Identifier (CID). The data is then split into chunks, encoded, and copied multiple times for reliability, before being sealed into storage sectors. Storage providers take care of the process, including the pre-commit, sealing, and final commit steps, and they continuously provide cryptographic proofs to verify the data remains intact. The CID can later be used to find, decode, and retrieve the original data.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, Greater China, North America, Africa, South America, Europe
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: I don't know yet, Venus built-in data transfer, Lotus built-in data transfer, IPFS
